entries.meaning: (rare) One who is not a priest.

verbs.description: unpriest (third-person singular simple present unpriests, present participle unpriesting, simple past and past participle unpriested)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To deprive of priesthood; to unfrock.
examples: The same thought Leo, bishop of Rome, Ep. 85, to the African bishops of Mauritania Caesariensis, wherein complaining of a certain priest, who divorcing his wife, or being divorced by her, as other copies have it, had married another, neither dissolves the matrimony, nor excommunicates him, only unpriests him.
